Description of incident: Forty-three restaurants nationwide may have been affected by a data breach involving unauthorized access to credit and debit card information. Customers who used credit or debit cards between early March and the end of April may have had their financial information obtained by unauthorized parties.UPDATE (06/15/2012): Penn Station updated the number of franchise locations affected.  They now claim that 80 restaurants in Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Michigan, Missouri, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Virginia, and West Virginia were affected by a point-of-sale processing hack.
